description: A sower went out to sow, and as he sowed, some seed fell by the wayside, some on stony places, some among thorns, and others on good ground.
revelation: The Word of God being received differently according to the heart's condition.

description: A younger son wastes his inheritance in a far country, but returns home to be welcomed by his father with a feast.
revelation: God's boundless mercy and joy over a repentant sinner.

description: A man is beaten and left for dead; a priest and a Levite pass him by, but a Samaritan stops to show mercy.
revelation: The call to love our neighbors without prejudice or limitation.

description: A merchant seeks fine pearls and finds one of such immense value that he sells everything he has to buy it.
revelation: The supreme value of the Kingdom of Heaven requiring total commitment.

description: A king forgives a servant a massive debt, but that servant then refuses to forgive a fellow servant a small debt.
revelation: Our obligation to forgive others just as God has forgiven us.

description: A shepherd leaves his ninety-nine sheep to go into the wilderness and find the one that is lost.
revelation: God's personal pursuit of every individual who wanders away.

description: A wise man builds his house on the rock, while a foolish man builds on the sand. The storm comes and only the house on the rock stands.
revelation: The importance of not just hearing but doing the Word of God for a solid spiritual foundation.

description: The Kingdom of Heaven is like a mustard seed, which is the smallest of all seeds but grows into the largest of garden plants.
revelation: The immense, pervasive growth of God's Kingdom from humble, small beginnings.

description: Ten virgins took their lamps to meet the bridegroom; five were wise and brought extra oil, and five were foolish and brought none.
revelation: The necessity of spiritual preparedness and vigilance for the return of Christ.

description: A master entrusts his servants with talents; two invest and double them, while one hides his talent in the earth.
revelation: Our responsibility to faithfully use the gifts and resources God has entrusted to us.

description: A man finds a treasure hidden in a field and, out of joy, sells everything he owns to buy that field.
revelation: The overwhelming joy and worth of finding the Kingdom of God.

description: A Pharisee prays with pride while a tax collector prays for mercy. Jesus declares the tax collector justified.
revelation: The value of humble repentance over self-righteous pride in the eyes of God.

description: A man builds bigger barns to store his wealth but dies that night, leaving everything behind.
revelation: The vanity of accumulating earthly riches without being 'rich toward God'.

description: A landowner hires workers at different times of the day but pays them all the same daily wage.
revelation: God's sovereign grace and generosity which is not based on human merit or seniority.

description: A man prepares a great feast and invites many, but they all make excuses. He then invites the poor and the outcasts.
revelation: The invitation to the Kingdom of God is open to all, but those who reject it lose their place.

description: A widow repeatedly asks an unjust judge for justice until he finally grants it to be rid of her.
revelation: The power of persistent, faithful prayer and God's willingness to answer his children.
